formula: a(n) = 2*a(n-1) + a(n-3) (holds at least up to n = 1000 but is not known to hold in general).
mathematica: RecurrenceTable[{a[0] == 4, a[1] == 9, a[n] == Floor[a[n - 1]^2/a[n - 2] + 1/2]}, a, {n, 0, 30}] (* _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016 *)
prog: (MAGMA) Exy:=[4,9]; [n le 2 select Exy[n] else Floor(Self(n-1)^2/Self(n-2) + 1/2): n in [1..40]]; // _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016
crossrefs: It appears that this is a subsequence of A008998.
See A008776 for definitions of Pisot sequences.
author: _David W. Wilson_
extensions: Deleted program based on unproved recurrence from _Bruno Berselli_, Feb 05 2016
